page.title: 18LAND,HOMES,PEOPLE - HAUGHTON
page.content: The block covered by Haughton & Dist. W.I.is a very small farming community. The area is basically intensive grass, used to produce silage and hay for grazing dairy cattle. Of the 295 head of population, 49 are under the age of 16, 160 between the ages of 16 - 50 and 86 over the age of 50. There are 107 houses and one flat built over the top of a large garage. The majority of the houses are detached and where they are semi-detached are in no more than blocks of four. Council owned property amounts to approx. 10 houses the rest split almost equally between owner occupied and tenanted. Of the tenanted property about 6 are farms owned by one landlord. Even in 1985 at least three of the houses have no inside or outside lavatories, although Council grants are available to provide them.
